column2: quia mīrābilia fēcit. Salvāvit sibi dextera ejus
column3: et bracchium sanctum ejus. ^ Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle
column4: because he hath done wonderful things. His right hand hath wrought for him salvation

column1: 2 ^ Nōtum fēcit Dominus salūtāre suum; in conspectū gentium revēlāvit jūstitiam suam. ^ The Lord hath made known his salvation; he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles.

3 ^ Recordātus est misericordiae suae et vēritātis suae domuī Isrāēlis. Vīdērunt omnēs terminī terrae salūtāre Deī nostrī. ^ He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

column3: et psallite. ^ Sing joyfully to God all the earth; make melody

column2: in cittarā et vōce psalmī. ^ Sing praise to the Lord on the harp
column4: and with the voice of a psalm.

column1: 6 ^ In tubīs ductilibus et vōce tubae corneae
column2: jūbilāte in conspectū rēgis Dominī. ^ With long trumpets
column3: and sound of cornet. Make a joyful noise before the sight of the king

column1: 7 ^ Moveātur mare et plēnitūdō ejus; orbis terrārum et quī habitant in eō. ^ Let the sea be moved and the fullness thereof; the world and they that dwell therein.
8 ^ Flūmina plaudent manū; simul montēs exsultābunt ā conspectū Dominī
column2: ^ The rivers shall clap their hands; the mountains shall rejoice together at the presence of the Lord

column1: 9 ^ quoniam venit jūdicāre terram. Jūdicābit orbem terrārum in jūstitiā
column2: et populōs in aequitāte. ^ because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice
